p: Baicalin ( Figure 4a), a constituent of the plant Baikal skullcap ( Scuttelaria baicalensis) ( Figure 4b), was been examined in this research under the same conditions and also revealed antiviral potential against SARS-CoV [ 15]. Baicalin has also been shown to inhibit the replication of the HIV-1 virus in vitro in previous publications [ 24, 65]. Nevertheless, it should be noted that in vitro findings may not correlate with in vivo clinical efficacy. This is because the oral quantity of these molecules in humans may not attain a blood serum dose comparable to that tested in vitro dose.
